FuncDef:
The router-id command sets a router ID for the router that runs OSPFv3.
The undo router-id command deletes the router ID that is set for an OSPFv3 router. The router-id command sets a router ID for the router that runs OSPFv3. The undo router-id command deletes the router ID that is set for an OSPFv3 router. By default, no router ID is configured for the router that runs OSPFv3. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a router ID.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.
